text: I have leader Rosie I'm the chef at
Chili's heel and Greenpoint in Brooklyn
today I'm going to show you how to cook
a steak directly on the coals fire
so if you want to cook a rib eye at home
you're gonna need a couple of props you
need some fire gloves to maneuver the
logs tongs an in surrey thermometer and
I have a custom-made rack to rest the
steaks on and at home you can use a
resting rack propped up on a couple of
bricks so I positioned all the burning
logs to the left here so they can have
access to these nice hot coals I'm gonna
do I'm gonna take the shovel I'm just
gonna kind of pull them out a little bit
that's gonna be our bed of coals that's
where I will go to the stake is gonna
lay the stake right on top that's it I'm
gonna let it sear on this side about
three to five minutes and flip it over
and do the same thing but in between I'm
also gonna fluff the coals a little bit
you're gonna see that these coals are

down because the stake is sitting on top
of it so
we have all the coals stuck to it you
just kind of brush them off there okay
so that's one side just gonna shift

hot coals right here
so at this point we could also just
start cooking from the radiant heat it's

the coals it's just like you put your
hand right where the meat is you could

that's that's a good amount
